faq_subtitle: Find quick answers to your questions
how_to_submit: How do I submit a new report?
how_to_submit_answer: To submit a new report, tap on the 'Report' tab at the bottom of the screen. Select a category, describe the issue, add photos, and provide the location. Then tap 'Submit'.
how_long_resolution: How long does it take to resolve an issue?
how_long_resolution_answer: Resolution time varies depending on the nature and complexity of the issue. Simple issues may be resolved within a few days, while more complex ones might take several weeks. You can track the status of your report in the app.
how_to_track: How can I track the status of my report?
how_to_track_answer: You can track the status of your report in the 'Profile' tab by selecting 'My reports'. You can also view details by selecting a specific report.
notifications_not_working: I'm not receiving notifications, what should I do?
notifications_not_working_answer: Check that notifications are enabled in both the app settings and your device settings. If the problem persists, try restarting the app or logging out and logging back in.
upload_failed: My photo upload failed, what should I do?
upload_failed_answer: Check your internet connection. If the problem persists, try reducing the photo size or selecting fewer photos at once. You can also try restarting the app.
geolocation_issues: The app can't detect my location, what should I do?
geolocation_issues_answer: Check that location access is enabled in your device settings and that you've granted permission to the app. If you're indoors, try going outside for a better GPS signal.

privacy_section_1_content: We collect certain personal information when you create an account, such as your name, email address, and phone number. We also collect location data when you submit a report, as well as any photos you upload.
privacy_section_2_content: We use your personal data to provide our services, improve our application, and communicate with you. Location data is used to pinpoint reported issues, and photos to document these issues.
privacy_section_3_content: We share your reports and associated data with local authorities responsible for resolving urban issues. We do not sell your personal data to third parties.
privacy_section_4_content: We implement technical and organizational security measures to protect your personal data against unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction.
privacy_section_5_content: You have the right to access your personal data, correct it, delete it, and limit its processing. You can also object to the processing of your data and request data portability.
terms_section_1_content: By using the CitizenSpeak application, you agree to be bound by these terms of service. If you do not agree to these terms, please do not use the application.
terms_section_2_content: You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account and password. You are also responsible for all activities that occur under your account.
terms_section_3_content: By submitting content to the application (text, photos, videos), you grant CitizenSpeak a non-exclusive license to use, modify, display, and distribute this content as part of our services.
terms_section_4_content: You agree not to use the application to submit false or misleading reports, to harass other users, or for any illegal activity.
terms_section_5_content: CitizenSpeak is not responsible for resolving reported issues, which is the responsibility of local authorities. We cannot guarantee that all reported issues will be resolved.

urgence_text_detailed: In case of emergency requiring immediate intervention (dangerous roads, major leaks, lighting failures in sensitive areas), contact emergency services directly.
comment_soumettre_answer: To submit a complaint about equipment or urban planning, tap the "+" button on the main screen, fill out the form with a detailed description, add photos if possible, and indicate the precise location of the problem. Your complaint will be automatically forwarded to the relevant services.
combien_temps_resolution: How long to resolve a complaint?
combien_temps_answer:
Processing time varies depending on the type of problem:
• Urgent issues (public lighting, dangerous roads): 24-48h
• Faulty equipment: 3-7 days
• Urban planning: 2-4 weeks
• Infrastructure projects: 1-3 months

You will receive notifications at each stage of processing.
comment_suivre_answer: After submission, your complaint receives a reference number. You can track its progress in the "My Complaints" tab where you'll see the status: Pending, In Progress, Assigned, Resolved, or Closed. Push notifications inform you of important updates.
quels_types_problemes: What types of problems can I report?
quels_types_answer:
You can report:
• Faulty public lighting
• Potholes and road deterioration
• Sanitation and sewer problems
• Poorly maintained green spaces
• Broken street furniture (benches, bus stops)
• Defective road signage
• Waste collection problems
• Accessibility for people with reduced mobility
pourquoi_photos_answer:
Check:
• Your internet connection
• Photo size (max 10MB per photo)
• Available storage space
• Camera access permissions

Try resizing your photos or taking them directly from the app. If the problem persists, contact technical support.
geolocalisation_answer:
Make sure that:
• Location services are enabled
• The app has permission to access your location
• Your GPS is enabled
• You are in an area with good coverage

You can also manually place the marker on the map or enter the address in the designated field.
signaler_anonymement_answer:
Yes, you can submit anonymous complaints. However, creating an account allows you to:
• Track the progress of your complaints
• Receive update notifications
• Access your reporting history
• Be contacted if clarifications are needed
comment_signaler_urgence_answer: For emergencies (dangerous roads, major leaks, lighting failure in sensitive areas), use the "Emergency" button when creating your complaint. These reports are treated as priority and immediately transmitted to the relevant emergency services.

mission_text: The Complaints Observatory is a citizen platform dedicated to improving urban quality of life. Our mission is to facilitate communication between citizens and municipal services for more efficient management of equipment and urban planning problems.
objectifs_text:
• Enable citizens to easily report urban problems
• Ensure transparent complaint tracking
• Improve problem resolution times
• Create a database for continuous improvement
• Promote citizen participation
domaines_text:
• Public lighting and signage
• Roads and transport
• Green spaces and environment
• Sanitation and cleanliness
• Street furniture
• Accessibility and safety
partenaires_text: Developed in partnership with municipal services and citizen associations. For more information about our partners or to join our network, contact us.
aucun_resultat_subtext: Try with other keywords or contact our support
collecte_text: We only collect information necessary for the observatory's operation: name, email, phone number, and location when reporting complaints. This data is used exclusively for processing your reports and communicating with you regarding their progress.
utilisation_text:
Your personal data is used to:
• Process and track your complaints
• Send you notifications about your reports' progress
• Improve our services
• Generate anonymized statistics
• Contact you if clarifications are needed
partage_text: Your data may be shared with relevant municipal services only for processing your complaints. We never sell your data to third parties and do not use it for commercial purposes.
geolocalisation_text: Location data is collected only when creating a complaint to precisely locate the reported problem. Photos you share are stored securely and used only to document your report.
droits_text:
You have the following rights:
• Right to access your personal data
• Right to correct inaccurate data
• Right to delete your data
• Right to object to processing
• Right to data portability
To exercise these rights, contact us at privacy@observatory-complaints.ma
securite_text: We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your data against unauthorized access, modification, disclosure, or destruction. All communications are encrypted and our servers comply with international security standards.
objet_text: The Complaints Observatory is a platform dedicated to reporting equipment and urban planning problems. By using this application, you accept these terms of use. These terms apply to all platform users.
utilisation_autorisee_text:
This platform should only be used to:
• Report real equipment or urban planning problems
• Track the progress of your reports
• View complaints in your region
• Communicate constructively with municipal services
obligations_text:
As a user, you commit to:
• Provide accurate and truthful information
• Not publish defamatory, offensive, or inappropriate content
• Respect others' privacy in your photos and descriptions
• Not overload the platform with abusive reports
• Use respectful language in your communications
contenu_text: You are solely responsible for the content you publish (descriptions, photos, comments). We reserve the right to moderate, modify, or delete any content deemed inappropriate, inaccurate, or contrary to these terms of use.
propriete_text: The application and its content (design, texts, logos, features) are protected by intellectual property rights. You retain ownership of content you publish but grant the observatory a license to use it for processing your reports.
limitation_text: The observatory facilitates communication between citizens and municipal services but cannot guarantee processing times or resolution of all reported problems. We are not responsible for decisions made by municipal services regarding your reports.
sanctions_text:
In case of non-compliance with these terms, we reserve the right to:
• Delete your inappropriate content
• Temporarily suspend your account
• Permanently terminate your platform access
• Report to relevant authorities in case of malicious use
modifications_text: These terms may be modified at any time. Users will be informed of important changes through app notifications. Continued use after modification constitutes acceptance of the new terms.
